Pre-Game Insights: Malawi National Football Team go into battle against Senegal in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers hoping to redeem their pride.
Burkina Faso have already qualified for the Afcon finals following a 2-0 victory over Burundi on Sunday.
Senegal are in pole position to take the remaining one slot in Group L with a win over Malawi.
Malawi need to get a positive result against star-studded Senegal to restore the bond of trust with the fans.
Coach Patrick Mabedi admitted that his charges would play for pride against Senegal on Mothersâ€™ Day.
Flames captain John Banda said they were geared to make the nation proud.
Mabedi will likely ring changes to the side that lost 4-0 on Friday.
Senegal have rediscovered their sparkle under the tutelage of interim coach Pape Thiaw.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Goalkeeper George Chikooka will be handed a starting role following the red card to Brighton Munthali.
Midfielders Chimwemwe Idana, Lloyd Aaron and Yamikani Chester are also likely to start this afternoon.
Banda will likely lead the team, with Dennis Chembezi, Nickson Mwase and Lanjesi Nkhoma likely to start the match.
Mabedi has also beefed up the squad with goalkeeper William Thole and defender Maxwell Paipi.
